title: USD 10 Mn received from WB for pharmaceutical purchases: Health Ministry
body_lines: Sri Lanka has received emergency funding of USD 10 million from the World Bank for purchasing of medicinal drugs, the Ministry of Health has said.

Quoting the Health Ministry in a statement, the Government Information Department said the health ministerial officials are currently in talks with the World Health Organization (WHO) and the Asian Development Bank (ADB) to procure necessary funds or pharmaceuticals.
Meanwhile, Letters of Credit (LCs) are being opened to import medicinal drugs and equipment from India under the Indian credit line, the statement read further.
